meanings.definition: The fact or condition of being common or ordinary.
meanings.sent1: The banality of the situation made it easy to predict.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was filled with the banality of everyday phrases.
meanings.sent3: The banality of the joke made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The banality of the task felt like a heavy weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The banality of the town was evident in its identical houses and streets.

meanings.definition: A commonplace or trite remark or action.
meanings.sent1: He couldn't stand the banality of small talk at parties.
meanings.sent2: The movie was full of banality, with cliched lines and predictable scenes.
meanings.sent3: She rolled her eyes at the banality of his pick-up line.
meanings.sent4: The banality of their arguments was like a broken record playing over and over.
meanings.sent5: The banality of the painting left the art critics unimpressed.
